docs.snippet: LEAD: A year after promising to begin a process of withdrawing aid to farmers in exporting crops, officials of the leading industrial countries concede that they have made no real progress and do not hold much hope for any soon.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Amy Elisabeth Harless, a daughter of Mrs. Ricardo Deambrosio of Lyme, Conn., and Montevideo, Uruguay, and Theodore James Harless of Port Chester, N.Y., was married yesterday to James Stillman Rockefeller Rose, a son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Harden Rose of New York and Bridgehampton, L.I. The Rev. Alastair Votaw performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Greenwich,

headline.main: James S. R. Rose And Amy Harless Wed in Greenwich

docs.snippet: LEAD: IS the international economic system more stable than it looks? Even in the age of Aquarius, are government leaders more rational than they seem? Is there, in short, a case for optimism about our ability to absorb shocks and threats to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IS the international economic system more stable than it looks? Even in the age of Aquarius, are government leaders more rational than they seem? Is there, in short, a case for optimism about our ability to absorb shocks and threats to the system, and, without actually solving any of the major problems we face, at least to survive them?

headline.main: Economic Scene; A Canadian Case For Optimism

docs.snippet: LEAD: HE CAME INTO MY office in San Salvador reeking of the vinegar-tinged sweat of simple human fear. His eyes rolled to show their whites as he insisted that ''they'' were trying to kill him. He said his name was Florencio Caballero and he wanted...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: HE CAME INTO MY office in San Salvador reeking of the vinegar-tinged sweat of simple human fear. His eyes rolled to show their whites as he insisted that ''they'' were trying to kill him. He said his name was Florencio Caballero and he wanted to tell me of his work as an interrogator in a Honduran Army death squad, which he said had tortured and then murdered approximately 120 Hondurans and other Latin Americans.

byline.original: By James LeMoyne; James LeMoyne is the El Salvador bureau chief for The Times. He has been reporting from Central America since 1982

docs.snippet: LEAD: Concluding 6 years of difficult negotiations, 33 nations have agreed to open all of Antarctica to regulated development of its oil and mineral resources, according to American participants in the talks.
